str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To engrave, imprint. From en and a derivative of tupos; to enstamp, i.e. Engrave.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
